001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009
010/** A helper class that converts Pose3d objects between different standard coordinate frames. */
011public class CoordinateSystem {
012  private static final CoordinateSystem m_nwu =
013      new CoordinateSystem(CoordinateAxis.N(), CoordinateAxis.W(), CoordinateAxis.U());
014  private static final CoordinateSystem m_edn =
015      new CoordinateSystem(CoordinateAxis.E(), CoordinateAxis.D(), CoordinateAxis.N());
016  private static final CoordinateSystem m_ned =
017      new CoordinateSystem(CoordinateAxis.N(), CoordinateAxis.E(), CoordinateAxis.D());
018
019  // Rotation from this coordinate system to NWU coordinate system
020  private final Rotation3d m_rotation;
021
022  /**
023   * Constructs a coordinate system with the given cardinal directions for each axis.
024   *
025   * @param positiveX The cardinal direction of the positive x-axis.
026   * @param positiveY The cardinal direction of the positive y-axis.
027   * @param positiveZ The cardinal direction of the positive z-axis.
028   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the coordinate system isn't special orthogonal
029   */
030  public CoordinateSystem(
031      CoordinateAxis positiveX, CoordinateAxis positiveY, CoordinateAxis positiveZ) {
032    // Construct a change of basis matrix from the source coordinate system to the
033    // NWU coordinate system. Each column vector in the change of basis matrix is
034    // one of the old basis vectors mapped to its representation in the new basis.
035    @SuppressWarnings("LocalVariableName")
036    var R = new Matrix<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N3());
037    R.assignBlock(0, 0, positiveX.m_axis);
038    R.assignBlock(0, 1, positiveY.m_axis);
039    R.assignBlock(0, 2, positiveZ.m_axis);
040
041    // Require that the change of basis matrix is special orthogonal. This is true
042    // if the axes used are orthogonal and normalized. The CoordinateAxis class
043    // already normalizes itself, so we just need to check for orthogonality.
044    if (!R.times(R.transpose()).equals(Matrix.eye(Nat.N3()))) {
045      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Coordinate system isn't special orthogonal");
046    }
047
048    // Turn change of basis matrix into a quaternion since it's a pure rotation
049    // https://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/matrixToQuaternion/
050    double trace = R.get(0, 0) + R.get(1, 1) + R.get(2, 2);
051    double w;
052    double x;
053    double y;
054    double z;
055
056    if (trace > 0.0) {
057      double s = 0.5 / Math.sqrt(trace + 1.0);
058      w = 0.25 / s;
059      x = (R.get(2, 1) - R.get(1, 2)) * s;
060      y = (R.get(0, 2) - R.get(2, 0)) * s;
061      z = (R.get(1, 0) - R.get(0, 1)) * s;
062    } else {
063      if (R.get(0, 0) > R.get(1, 1) && R.get(0, 0) > R.get(2, 2)) {
064        double s = 2.0 * Math.sqrt(1.0 + R.get(0, 0) - R.get(1, 1) - R.get(2, 2));
065        w = (R.get(2, 1) - R.get(1, 2)) / s;
066        x = 0.25 * s;
067        y = (R.get(0, 1) + R.get(1, 0)) / s;
068        z = (R.get(0, 2) + R.get(2, 0)) / s;
069      } else if (R.get(1, 1) > R.get(2, 2)) {
070        double s = 2.0 * Math.sqrt(1.0 + R.get(1, 1) - R.get(0, 0) - R.get(2, 2));
071        w = (R.get(0, 2) - R.get(2, 0)) / s;
072        x = (R.get(0, 1) + R.get(1, 0)) / s;
073        y = 0.25 * s;
074        z = (R.get(1, 2) + R.get(2, 1)) / s;
075      } else {
076        double s = 2.0 * Math.sqrt(1.0 + R.get(2, 2) - R.get(0, 0) - R.get(1, 1));
077        w = (R.get(1, 0) - R.get(0, 1)) / s;
078        x = (R.get(0, 2) + R.get(2, 0)) / s;
079        y = (R.get(1, 2) + R.get(2, 1)) / s;
080        z = 0.25 * s;
081      }
082    }
083
084    m_rotation = new Rotation3d(new Quaternion(w, x, y, z));
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Returns an instance of the North-West-Up (NWU) coordinate system.
089   *
090   * <p>The +X axis is north, the +Y axis is west, and the +Z axis is up.
091   *
092   * @return An instance of the North-West-Up (NWU) coordinate system.
093   */
094  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
095  public static CoordinateSystem NWU() {
096    return m_nwu;
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Returns an instance of the East-Down-North (EDN) coordinate system.
101   *
102   * <p>The +X axis is east, the +Y axis is down, and the +Z axis is north.
103   *
104   * @return An instance of the East-Down-North (EDN) coordinate system.
105   */
106  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
107  public static CoordinateSystem EDN() {
108    return m_edn;
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Returns an instance of the North-East-Down (NED) coordinate system.
113   *
114   * <p>The +X axis is north, the +Y axis is east, and the +Z axis is down.
115   *
116   * @return An instance of the North-East-Down (NED) coordinate system.
117   */
118  @SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
119  public static CoordinateSystem NED() {
120    return m_ned;
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Converts the given translation from one coordinate system to another.
125   *
126   * @param translation The translation to convert.
127   * @param from The coordinate system the pose starts in.
128   * @param to The coordinate system to which to convert.
129   * @return The given translation in the desired coordinate system.
130   */
131  public static Translation3d convert(
132      Translation3d translation, CoordinateSystem from, CoordinateSystem to) {
133    return translation.rotateBy(from.m_rotation.minus(to.m_rotation));
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Converts the given rotation from one coordinate system to another.
138   *
139   * @param rotation The rotation to convert.
140   * @param from The coordinate system the rotation starts in.
141   * @param to The coordinate system to which to convert.
142   * @return The given rotation in the desired coordinate system.
143   */
144  public static Rotation3d convert(
145      Rotation3d rotation, CoordinateSystem from, CoordinateSystem to) {
146    return rotation.rotateBy(from.m_rotation.minus(to.m_rotation));
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Converts the given pose from one coordinate system to another.
151   *
152   * @param pose The pose to convert.
153   * @param from The coordinate system the pose starts in.
154   * @param to The coordinate system to which to convert.
155   * @return The given pose in the desired coordinate system.
156   */
157  public static Pose3d convert(Pose3d pose, CoordinateSystem from, CoordinateSystem to) {
158    return pose.relativeTo(new Pose3d(new Translation3d(), to.m_rotation.minus(from.m_rotation)));
159  }
160}
